clues.text: A type of horse race & a type of man's hat are both named for Edward Stanley, 12th Earl of this place
Hazelnuts are also called this, after a saint whose feast day falls in the nutting season
Adjective for gaudy, tasteless finery, from the cheap lace sold at St. Audrey's Fair at Ely, England
Some claim this word is derived from backwards spelling of Muldoon, the name of a gangster
Compound word for "downcast", it 1st described roosters whose combs had been beaten down in cockfights
Among the states, only Texas & Alaska produce more of this resource than Louisiana
Annual event called "the greatest free show on earth"
Houston's Astrodome could actually fit inside this Louisiana structure
Common in Louisiana, this plant has no roots, hangs from trees & absorbs water from the air

Who can forget 1972, when the first of these led to the cancellation of 86 games that were never rescheduled?
We all recall 1884, when Kentuckian Pete Browning used the first bat nicknamed this
Surely you recall 1867, when Candy Cummings is credited with debuting this first breaking pitch
In this novel, Holden Caulfield observes, "All morons hate it when you call them a moron"
A mouse named Mr. Jingles does some time in prison in this Stephen King book
In books by Rick Riordan, Percy Jackson's first name is short for this one from mythology

rounds.text: It was the first election since 1952 in which neither the incumbent president nor the incumbent vice president was a candidate
